intro: Porphyra dichotoma, commonly known as the rockweed or Irish moss, is a species of red algae belonging to the family Bangiaceae. It is characterized by its branching, filamentous structure and a bright red to purple coloration. This plant typically grows in intertidal zones, attaching itself to rocks and other substrates in coastal environments. Porphyra dichotoma thrives in cold, nutrient-rich waters and is often found in the northern hemisphere. It plays an important ecological role in marine ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various marine organisms.
